intro: Palmijuncus polygamus, commonly known as the African palm squirrel or the African palm civet, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by fruit that is edible and used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas and along riverbanks. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
